headline.main: Small Businesses Hope to See Obama-Backed Rules Scrapped
headline.print_headline: Small Businesses Hope to See Obama-Backed Rules Scrapped

docs.lead_paragraph: Small businesses are hoping to see some high-profile Obama administration regulations scrapped after Donald Trump takes office, with rules affecting overtime, sick leave and the environment among those that may be taken off the books.

headline.main: Plan to Repeal Obama Health Law Shows GOP Governors Are Torn
headline.print_headline: Plan to Repeal Obama Health Law Shows GOP Governors Are Torn

docs.lead_paragraph: The nation's governors don't want people in their states to lose health coverage under a repeal of the Obama-era health care law, but even after a weekend of bipartisan meetings, they still don't agree on the best approach to replace it.
docs.snippet: The nation's governors don't want people in their states to lose health coverage under a repeal of the Obama-era health care law, but even after a weekend of bipartisan meetings, they still don't agree on the best approach to replace it....

headline.main: Trump 'Won't Be Worse Than Obama,' Says Venezuela's President
headline.print_headline: Trump 'Won't Be Worse Than Obama,' Says Venezuela's President

docs.lead_paragraph: Venezuela's socialist leader said on Monday that U.S. President-elect Donald Trump was the victim of a global "hate campaign" and could not be worse than outgoing Barack Obama.

headline.main: New Interior Chief Vows Review of Obama-Era Rules,' Bold' Restructuring
headline.print_headline: New Interior Chief Vows Review of Obama-Era Rules,' Bold' Restructuring

docs.lead_paragraph: New Interior Secretary Ryan Zinke plans to review Obama-era measures that limited energy development on some federal land and undertake a "bold" reorganization of his 70,000-employee agency, he said on Friday.

headline.main: More Clemency Coming After Obama Shortens Manning's Sentence
headline.print_headline: More Clemency Coming After Obama Shortens Manning's Sentence

docs.lead_paragraph: Embracing his clemency powers like never before, President Barack Obama is planning more commutations in his final days in office after a dramatic move to cut short convicted leaker Chelsea Manning's sentence.
